byline.original: By PATRICK McGEEHAN, ELI ROSENBERG and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS
byline.contributor: Patrick McGeehan reported from Hoboken, and Eli Rosenberg and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York. Reporting was contributed by Matt A.V. Chaban, David W. Chen, Annie Correal, Noah Remnick and Samantha Schmidt from New Jersey, and Richard Pérez-Peña, William K. Rashbaum and Marc Santora from New York. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A New Jersey Transit train crashed into a station on Thursday, unleashing chaos as part of the station’s roof came down.

headline.main: Hoboken Train Crash Kills 1 and Injures Over 100

snippet: A New Jersey Transit train crashed into a station on Thursday, unleashing chaos as part of the station’s roof came down....
abstract: New Jersey Transit commuter train crashes into terminal in Hoboken, causing debris to fly and part of station roof to collapse, killing one person and injuring over 100 others; National Transportation Safety Board and Federal Railroad Administration are currently investigating cause of train crash.
